titles.title: Betty Dick Residence Protection Act
To require the Secretary of the Interior to permit continued occupancy and use of certain lands and improvements within Rocky Mountain National Park.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 109-114.

calendar.text: Placed on the Private Calendar, Calendar No. 1.

action.text: Called up from the Private Calendar for consideration.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 109-201.

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Recreation, and Public Lands
committee.name: House Resources

bill.summary: 6/29/2005--Passed House without amendment. Betty Dick Residence Protection Act - Permits continued occupancy and use of specified property by Betty Dick for the remainder of her natural life, subject to certain requirements.
